Item.text: _user_ and Jordan, Welcome. I am Cristina. I will be your instructor for todays activities.
Item.speech: _user_ and Jordan, Welcome. I am Cristina. I will be your instructor for todays activities.

Item.text: _user_, Hey there. Hope you're ready for an exciting lesson! Cristina, what are we doing today?
Item.speech: _user_, Hey there. Hope you're ready for an exciting lesson! Cristina, what are we doing today?

Item.text: Today, we are going to look at advertisements that use nonliteral language, We will follow the steps of the clarifying strategy to help us understand what the writer is saying.
Item.speech: Today, we are going to look at advertisements that use nonliteral langwidge, We will follow the steps of the clarifying strategy to help us understand what the writer is saying.

Item.text: Sounds cool. I see adds and commercials every day and sometimes I have no idea what in the world they are talking about.
Item.speech: Sounds cool. I see adds and commercials every day and sometimes I have no idea what in the world they are talking about.

Item.text: _user_ and Jordan Alright , let's look at the first add.
Item.speech: _user_ and Jordan Alright , let's look at the first add.

Item.text: Looks like that is all the time we have for this activity. You got all the way through. thank you so much for all your hard work.
_user_, We did pretty well. You carried most of the weight today , so the credit goes to you.

Just remember to think about your clarifying strategy whenever you run into a word or phrase that is difficult to understand. The words or phrase may be a piece of non literal language and you may need to use your strategy to figure out the meaning.
Cristina, thanks. I will think about it. Bye.

Question.text: If you need to look at the image again, press on the advertisement to make it bigger. When you are ready, press the ex in the upper right hand corner to make the ad smaller and answer the question. Which part of this advertisement uses nonliteral language? press the correct answer.
Question.speech: If you need to look at the image again, press on the advertisement to make it bigger. When you are ready, press the ex in the upper right hand corner to make the ad smaller and answer the question. Which part of this advertisement uses nonliteral langwidge? press the correct answer.

Answer.name: TG
Answer.text: The part of this advertisement that uses nonliteral language is, one sip and you're in heaven. When we read this literally, it does not make sense.
Answer.speech: The part of this advertisement that uses nonliteral langwidge is, one sip and you're in heaven. When we read this literally, it does not make sense.

Answer.name: SG
Answer.text: I bet its the last choice, one sip and you're in heaven.
Answer.speech: I bet its the last choice, one sip and you're in heaven.

Answer.name: SB
Answer.text: I bet its the first choice, international tea company.
Answer.speech: I bet its the first choice, international tea company.

Question.text: Is there a comparison being made in the slogan, one sip and you're in heaven? Please press yes or no.
Question.speech: Is there a comparison being made in the slogan, one sip and you're in heaven. Please press a response.

Answer.name: TG
Answer.text: There is a comparison being made in this slogan. Metaphors are a type of nonliteral language that makes comparisons without using, like, or, as. The comparison does not use, like, or, as, so this is a metaphor. The ad is comparing the feeling you get from tasting the tea to the feeling you get from being in heaven.
Answer.speech: There is a comparison being made in this slogan. Metaphors are a type of nonliteral langwidge that makes comparisons without using, like, or, as.The comparison does not use, like, or, as, so this is a metaphor. the ad is comparing the feeling you get from tasting the tea to the feeling you get from being in heaven.

Answer.name: SG
Answer.text: I think there is a comparison here.
Answer.speech: I think there is a comparison here.

Answer.name: SB
Answer.text: I don't think there is a comparison here.
Answer.speech: I don't think there is a comparison here.

Question.text: Why is the writer comparing, a sip of tea, and, being in heaven? Please press the correct response.
Question.speech: Why is the writer comparing, a sip of tea, and, being in heaven. Please press the correct response.

Answer.name: TG
Answer.text: Here, the writer compares a sip of tea to being in heaven to describe how drinking the tea makes the reader feel.

Answer.name: SG
Answer.text: I think its the second answer, to describe how the tea makes the reader feel.
Answer.speech: I think its the second answer, to describe how the tea makes the reader feel.

Answer.name: SB
Answer.text: I think its the third answer, to describe how to make tea.
Answer.speech: I think its the third answer, to describe how to make tea.

Question.text: What is the intended meaning of, one sip and you're in heaven? Please press the correct response.
Question.speech: What is the intended meaning of, one sip and you're in heaven. Please press the correct response.

Answer.name: TG
Answer.text: The intended meaning of this metaphor is, to make you feel very happy and relaxed.
Answer.speech: The intended meaning of this metaphor is, to make you feel very happy and relaxed.

Answer.name: SG
Answer.text: I think its the second choice, to make you feel very happy and relaxed.
Answer.speech: I think its the second choice, to make you feel very happy and relaxed.

Answer.name: SB
Answer.text: I think its the third choice, to make you leave your house.
Answer.speech: I think its the third choice, to make you leave your house.

Question.text: Which of these is a good replacement for the nonliteral language, one sip and you're in heaven? Please press the correct response.
Question.speech: Which of these is a good replacement for the nonliteral langwidge, one sip and your in heaven. Please press the correct response.

Answer.name: TG
Answer.text: The appropriate replacement is, this tea makes you feel very happy and relaxed.
Answer.speech: The appropriate replacement is, this tea makes you feel very happy and relaxed.

Answer.name: SG
Answer.text: I am willing to bet its the second answer, drinking this tea makes you feelvery happy and relaxed.
Answer.speech: I am willing to bet its the second answer, drinking this tea makes you feel very happy and relaxed.

Answer.name: SB
Answer.text: I am willing to bet its the third answer, this tea is from all over the world.
Answer.speech: I am willing to bet its the third answer, this tea is from all over the world.

Rule.name: Start
Rule.description: Start the lesson. To GetTutoringPack

Rule.name: Tutoring
Rule.description: AskMainQuestion. To LoadMedia

Rule.name: MainPage
Rule.description: Main page loaded. A img pops up. Waiting for user to press. To WaitToLeaveMainPage

Rule.name: LeaveMainPage
Rule.description: Page loaded and img pressed. To StartItem

Rule.name: LeaveMainPage2
Rule.description: time out. To StartItem rule.

Rule.name: StartItem
Rule.description: AskMainQuestion for each item and wait. To WaitForAnswer

Rule.name: CorrectJC
Rule.description: both correct, positive feedback, good answer. To next item.

Rule.name: CorrectJI
Rule.description: user correct, jordan incorrect, eedback, good answer. To next item.

Rule.name: IncorrectJC
Rule.description: user incorrect, jordan correct. feedback, correct answer. To next item.

Rule.name: IncorrectJI
Rule.description: user incorrect, jordan correct. feedback, correct answer. To next item.

Rule.name: unsureJC
Rule.description: user unsure, jordan correct. feedback, correct answer. To next item.

Rule.name: unsureJI
Rule.description: user unsure, jordan incorrect. feedback, correct answer. To next item.

Rule.name: Blank
Rule.description: Otherwise rule. Pump and to WaitForAnswer1 rule.

Rule.name: Correct1
Rule.description: Pumped answer correct. Positve feedback, correct answer. To next item.

Rule.name: Incorrect1
Rule.description: Pumped answer incorrect, neutral feedback, correct answer. To next item.

Rule.name: unsure1
Rule.description: Pumped answer unsure, neutral feedback, correct answer. To next item.

Rule.name: Blank1
Rule.description: Otherwise rule for pump. To next item.

Rule.name: GetItem
Rule.description: Check if there is more item. To nextitem rules.

Rule.name: HasItem
Rule.description: There is next item. Show item. To StartItem rule.

Rule.name: NoMoreItem
Rule.description: Item on the page finished. Go to next tutoring pack.
